metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14347 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way xserver memory was not properly initialized. This could leak parts of server memory to the X client. In cases where Xorg server runs with elevated privileges, this could result in possible ASLR bypass. Xorg-server before version 1.20.9 is vulnerable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xorg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm2').
xorg-server-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
